newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian-Russian Inv. Bank to pay 3 pct dividend.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian-Russian Inv. Bank to pay 3 pct dividend.

text.p: The private Bulgarian-Russian Investment Bank (BRIB) will distribute three percent dividend from a 63.5 million lev net profit for 1996, the bank's executive director said on Friday.

"The bank will use 37.5 million levs of last year's net profit to pay three percent dividend to shareholders. The remaining 26 million levs will be transferred to the reserve fund," Svetoslav Bozhilov told Reuters.
The bank's balance profit before provisioning and tax payments totalled 425.8 million levs, bank figures showed. @

The BRIB annual shareholders' meeting on Saturday is expected to authorise the bank's directors to raise capital up to 25 billion levs without calling a new shareholders meeting. So far bank's capital target was set at five billion levs.
"The higher capital target is in line with anticipated rise of central bank minimum capital requirements," Bozhilov said.
Under current central bank regulations local commercial banks are to have 1.4 billion levs capital for a domestic licence and 2.2 billion levs for a full one by March 31.
By end-March the BRIB's paid-in capital will amount to 2.5 billion levs, Bozhilov said. @
The BRIB, set up as a joint Bulgarian-Russian financial institution in May 1994, was licensed by the central bank in January 1995 for banking operations both in the country and abroad.
Apart from state-owned Bulbank the BRIB has been the only private bank in Bulgaria with a committed dividend to its shareholders so far. -- Roumiana Tikholova, Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
